candidates.title: fix: add missing dependency versions for cargo publish
candidates.body:
Adds version specifications to local path dependencies in `common`, `roles-logic-sv2`, `bip32-derivation`, and `rpc` crates.

The absence of those versions made the `cargo publish` workflow to fail: https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/actions/runs/16174649282/job/45656653602

candidates.title: Fix unnecessary version bumps done by mistake
candidates.body:
This PR fixes some version bumps we did by mistake on PR https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/pull/1728.

- `framing_sv2` was already bumped from `4.0.0` to `5.0.0` in https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/pull/1667
- `common_messages_sv2` was already bumped from `4.0.0` to `5.0.0` in https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/pull/1654

candidates.title: Implements roles functionality to write logs to file and set log level
candidates.body:
closes #677

introduces improved logging capabilities across multiple components, providing more flexibility and control over log output. Key updates include:

* **Configurable Log Levels**
  Users can now set the verbosity of logs using levels such as `debug`, `info`, `warn`, and `error`.

* **Optional Log File Output**
  Logs can optionally be written to a file via the `-f` flag, in addition to standard output (`stdout`), supporting better log persistence and analysis.

* **Verbose Mode**
  When `-v` is used in combination with `-f`, logs are written to both `stdout` and the specified log file.

These enhancements do **not** affect the existing "Getting Started" tutorial or existing default behavior.

### Example Usage

```bash
cargo run -- --config config-examples/pool-config-local-tp-example.toml -v -f pool.log --log-level debug
```

This will:

* Write logs to both `stdout` and `pool.log`
* Set the log level to `DEBUG`

### Default Behavior

* **Log Level:**
  Defaults to `INFO` if no level is specified or if an invalid level is provided.

* **Log Output:**
  If `-f` is not set, logs are printed only to `stdout`.

* **Verbose Mode (`-v`):**
  Requires `-f` to be set. When used, logs are written to both `stdout` and the specified file.

* **No Flags Provided:**
  If none of the new flags are used, behavior remains unchanged: logs are printed to `stdout` at `INFO` level, maintaining compatibility with existing usage and tutorials.

candidates.title: deprecate `mining_proxy_sv2` and related modules of `roles_logic_sv2`
candidates.body:
the original motivation of this PR was #1466 

as described on this issue, the entire `roles_logic_sv2::common_properties` module felt somewhat redundant, since most of its meaningful usage happened inside `mining_proxy_sv2` crate, which we've been considering deprecation https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/discussions/1643

in fact, not only this module, but also `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::proxy_group_channel` and `roles_logic_sv2::job_dispatcher` and a significant portion of `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory`

so I went ahead with a more practical approach:
- deprecate `mining_proxy_sv2` crate
- deprecate `roles_logic_sv2::common_properties` module
- deprecate `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::proxy_group_channel`
- deprecate `roles_logic_sv2::job_dispatcher`

this incurred in small adaptations to:
- `pool_sv2`
- `translator_sv2`
- `jd_client`

there were also relatively large adaptations to `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory` which stripped it of a lot of functions that were rendered unused

`roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory` remains used on  `translator_sv2` (where it will likely be replaced via [#1623](https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/issues/1623)) and `jd_client`

once #1623 is addressed, the only thing preventing deprecation of `roles_logic_sv2::channel_logic::channel_factory` (#1634) will be its usage on `jd_client`

close #1466 
close #1464

candidates.title: fix unnecessary version bumps
candidates.body:
done by mistake on #1728

`job_declaration_sv2` already had MAJOR bumped via #1629 (v3.0.0 to v4.0.0)

`mining_sv2` already had MAJOR bumped via #1651 (v3.0.0 to v4.0.0)

both crates have not yet been published to crates.io, and we were bumping MINOR for both on #1728 

that would have resulted in publishing both crates under v4.1.0, without ever having published v4.0.0

in other words, the changes introduced on #1728 are already covered by the MAJOR bumps that have not yet been published, so no extra MINOR bump is needed

candidates.title: update imports in `roles` and `tests` to reflect library reorganization
candidates.body:
As discussed in #1740, this PR proposes an alternative solution to close #1458.

All roles have been updated to follow the new import scheme proposed in #1740:

![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c116410-42b8-4525-87e2-47ac37e45441)

---

### Notes for Reviewers

During the migration to the new import structure, I observed that `stratum-common` was previously used solely to re-export the `bitcoin` and `secp256k1` crates.

With the new structure, however, `roles-logic-sv2` is now a dependency of `stratum-common`. This introduces a circular dependency if `roles-logic-sv2` continues to access the `bitcoin` crate via `stratum-common`.

To break this cycle, I removed the `bitcoin` and `secp256k1` re-exports from `stratum-common`. Any crates that previously relied on those re-exports now import the required crates directly.

---

### Version Bumps

* `stratum-common`: **2.0.0 → 3.0.0**
  Reason: Removed the `bitcoin` feature and introduced new features

* `network-helpers-sv2`: **3.1.0 → 4.0.0**
  Reason: Removed the `binary_Sv2` feature

candidates.title: Refactor CLI argument parsing with `clap`
candidates.body:
closes #1703 
closes #1704 

This pull request refactors the CLI argument parsing across multiple modules to use the [`clap`](https://crates.io/crates/clap) crate. The goal is to improve **maintainability**, **consistency**, and **readability** by replacing custom argument parsing logic with `clap`’s declarative approach.

* Migrated from manual CLI parsing to `clap`-based parsing.
* Reduced redundancy and simplified argument handling across modules.
* Preserved existing command names and default values to ensure backward compatibility.

**Testing:**

* Verified functionality by following the instructions in the [Getting Started guide](https://stratumprotocol.org/getting-started/#ii-getting-started---running-all-roles).
* Confirmed that no CLI APIs were broken as a result of this refactor.

candidates.title: realocate constants to their specific crates
candidates.body:
IMO the approach of #1642 was suboptimal

moving the contents from `const_sv2` into `stratum_common` was a bit redundant, since we ended up still having all constants concentrated in one single place

constants should live in the specific crates where they have contextual meaning

this led to confusion such as https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/commit/a658b8ed6a3f5a01573e24cd80871b8f2a78853c

some further context here: https://github.com/stratum-mining/stratum/commit/37e7aaa4a8d88a453c3dd93840238c457585664b#r158043443

candidates.title: Allow specifying descriptors (including `raw` and `addr`) as coinbase outputs
candidates.body:
Fixes #1652.

Draft because I need to update the example configuration files and the documentation. But I am using this with my Bitaxes. Tried both the `raw` and the `addr` descriptor and was able to use a vanitygenned address which previously was impossible to specify.

candidates.title: Refactor and unification of `CoinbaseOutput` type
candidates.body:
Currently there are three `CoinbaseOutput` types: one in protocols/v2/roles-logic-sv2 which I believe is intended to be the "real" type, one in `roles/roles-utils/config-helpers` which I believe is intended to be a mirror of the coinbase outputs specified in the TOML config, and one in `roles/pool` which I believe should've been combined with the second one in #1507 but was missed.

However, both the "real" and "config" types are identical and neither has any invariants enforced on them; they are just a pair of strings. This PR combines these all into one type. In my next PR I will add invariants and make it impossible to construct this type, even from serde, except with a valid coinbase output. I will then extend the type to allow parsing not only the current type/value format, but also a new descriptor format which will cover more usecases and be more compatible with wallets.

This is a first step toward #1652.

candidates.title: introduce simplified APIs for channel and job logic (server side)
candidates.body:
partially addresses #1630 

so far, the APIs were designed and tested for server side functionality, namely Sv2 Pool Servers and Sv2 Job Declaration Clients (in other words, roles that actively create jobs from templates and custom jobs)

client side functionality (for Sv2 Mining Devices and Proxies) will require a follow-up PR

---

- [x] extended channel APIs (missing coinbase validation for custom job [#133@sv2-spec](https://github.com/stratum-mining/sv2-spec/issues/133))
- [x] extended job APIs
- [x] extended channel unit tests (missing coinbase validation for custom job [#133@sv2-spec](https://github.com/stratum-mining/sv2-spec/issues/133))
- [x] standard channel APIs
- [x] standard job APIs
- [x] standard channel unit tests
- [x] group channel APIs
- [x] group channel unit tests

candidates.body:
Partially addresses #1135 

IMO trying to fix the sv2.h file and interop test is a waste of time. It is using `cbindgen` v0.21(latest is 0.28) which does not seem to support specific features when building a crate(i.e., cant build `startum-common` only with `constants` feature). I would suggest to remove the CI checks for these and in the future rewrite them properly and add proper CI checks.
